pendingActions.notes: Sessions: agent:research-lead:1 (Prepwise), agent:research-lead:20260218-1635 (failed), agent:research-lead:2 (Ripple). Need cleanup.

pendingActions.what: Investigate and fix subagent parallel spawn issue
pendingActions.notes: Operator identified Lane queue mechanism as root cause. Deep dive into OpenClaw source found 4 lanes: main, cron, subagent, nested. sessions_spawn hardcodes lane=subagent (concurrency 96). gateway call agent defaults to lane=nested (concurrency 1). Both PL and RL use sessions_spawn identically. No lane argument passed anywhere in factory code. RL parallel spawns work fine (4-5 agents). PL parallel spawns fail (8-12 agents become zombies). Same mechanism, different results.

waitingOn.what: Operator guidance on fixing subagent parallel spawning
waitingOn.notes: Investigated lane mechanism. Both PL and RL spawn identically via sessions_spawn (lane=subagent, concurrency 96). No lane argument passed in factory code. RL works, PL doesn't. No config difference found. Operator says 'we just need PL to spawn subagents like RL does'.

notes.text: Pre-compaction #23 state flush. Research Lead 4 completed successfully: Triage (43/50) - Screenshot inbox zero for iPhone. Problem: 1000+ screenshots mixed with photos. Solution: Swipe-based triage (right=keep, left=delete, up=actions). Novel: First inbox zero for screenshots. Passes Value Source Analysis (works on existing photos, no external data). Development: 46-58 stories. PRD copied to /Users/austenallred/Sync/Triage-prd.md. Current pipeline: 4 ideas ready (Prepwise 46/50, Ripple 46/50 flagged, Triage 43/50, ClaimDone 43/50).

Pre-compaction #22 state flush. LANE INVESTIGATION: Operator pointed to 'Lane' queue mechanism as the bottleneck for subagent parallel spawning. Deep dive into OpenClaw source code found: 4 lanes exist (main, cron, subagent, nested). sessions_spawn hardcodes lane=AGENT_LANE_SUBAGENT. openclaw gateway call agent defaults to lane=AGENT_LANE_NESTED. Both PL and RL use sessions_spawn identically â€” no lane argument passed anywhere in factory code (AGENTS.md, openclaw.json, flow docs). RL parallel spawns work (Carson, Victor, Maya, Quinn all active with ~9k tokens each). PL parallel spawns fail (8-12 agents become zombies at 0 tokens). KEY FINDING: nested lane has default concurrency of 1 (never configured at startup), but this should only affect orchestrator turns, not their spawned subagents which use the subagent lane. Still no explanation for why PL subagents fail but RL subagents succeed. Possibly scale-related (RL spawns 4-5, PL spawns 8-12) or related to PL 60s heartbeat causing lane contention.
Pre-compaction #21 state flush. Serial spawn test initiated. CONFIRMED SYSTEMIC OPENCLAW BUG: 4 spawn attempts with consistent 80-85% zombie rate.
